trails.name: Chickadee Ridge
trails.summary: A very popular area, due to its stunning views and relatively low effort required.

trails.name: Spooner Lake to Tunnel Creek Station
trails.summary: A hike from Spooner Lake to Marlette Lake and the Marlette Flume Trail with great views of Lake Tahoe
trails.conditionDetails: Snowy, Icy - It's great for snowshoes or Yaktrax. Good conditions considering the amount of snow on the ground.

trails.name: Hunter Creek Trail
trails.summary: An out-and-back, mostly sun-exposed, path along Hunter Creek, featuring a waterfall.
trails.conditionDetails: Snowy, Some Mud - Did this hike today; there's two muddy areas in the first 0.5 mile of the hike. Snow and some ice in the last 0.5 miles.

trails.name: Mt. Rose Summit Trail
trails.summary: One of the most popular summits in Nevada - and deservedly so!

trails.name: Lakeview Hobart Loop
trails.summary: Strenuous hike with varied terrain and spectacular views.

trails.name: Whites - Thomas - Dry Pond Loop
trails.summary: An epic loop connecting Whites Creek Trail, Dry Pond Trail, and Upper Thomas Creek Trail.

trails.name: Hunter Lake Loop
trails.summary: A challenging trail with several steep sections but beautiful scenery.

trails.name: Donner State Park Tour
trails.summary: A perfect beginner trail to tour Donner Memorial State Park and finish with a cool dip in Donner Lake.

trails.name: Ballardini Ranch Figure 8 Trail
trails.summary: A double loop trail through Ballardini Ranch.

trails.name: Great Trail Epic Course 2017
trails.summary: The Epic course from Truckee to Tahoe City.

trails.name: Houghton Loop
trails.summary: The Houghton Loop includes parts of the Tahoe Rim Trail, Mount Houghton Spur, and the Relay Peak Road.

trails.name: Tahoe Meadows Interpretive Loop Trail
trails.summary: The perfect easy but interesting route for families, or to experience the area quickly and easily.

trails.name: PCT: Echo Lake to Highway 80 (Donner Summit)
trails.summary: The Lake Tahoe section of the PCT features some of the most beautiful sections of wilderness in the Northern Sierras.

trails.name: Marlette Flume Trail
trails.summary: A narrow singletrack trail with jaw-dropping views.

trails.name: TRT: Tahoe Meadows to Spooner Summit
trails.summary: A spectacular TRT section known for its incredible views of both Lake Tahoe and Marlene Lake.

trails.name: Whites Creek Trail
trails.summary: This busy trail follows the creek up through beautiful pine forest.

trails.name: Western States Trail
trails.summary: A mix of singletrack and fire road that links Hwy 89 to Forest Road 06.

trails.name: Ballardini Ranch - Timberline Connector
trails.summary: This new trail offers seclusion and sweeping views.

trails.name: Martis Peak Road (16N92)
trails.summary: This short family-friendly trek to the fire lookout station offers excellent views of Lake Tahoe and Truckee.

trails.name: Dry Pond Trail
trails.summary: A steep trail with lots of switchbacks up to Dry Pond.

trails.name: Cold Valley Trail
trails.summary: A beautiful, mostly flat trail through a forested valley.

trails.name: Sagehen Creek Trail
trails.summary: An inviting hike with lush flowers in spring and early summer.

trails.name: Sawtooth Trail
trails.summary: An adventurous hike with easy access from downtown Truckee.

trails.name: Tunnel Creek Road
trails.summary: A downhill cruise or a challenging uphill depending on which way you hike this dirt road.

trails.name: TRT: Brockway Summit to Tahoe Meadows
trails.summary: A steady climb through northern Tahoe's craggy peaks to expansive views of the Lake Tahoe Basin.

trails.name: TRT: Tahoe City to Brockway Summit
trails.summary: A mountainous traverse through fields, forests, and ancient lava flows with spectacular Tahoe views.

trails.name: FS Road #16N52
trails.summary: Scenic doubletrack with views of Lake Tahoe.

trails.name: Hunter Lake Trail
trails.summary: A very challenging hike up rocky terrain with 3000+ feet of elevation gain.

trails.name: Overland Emigrant Commemorative Trail
trails.summary: A winding singletrack paralleling the emigrant route through meadows and forests.

trails.name: Perimeter Loop
trails.summary: A long outer loop that traverses the park's lower slopes.

trails.name: Cold Canyon Spur
trails.summary: A beautiful trail across sage fields with views of Washoe Valley.

trails.name: Zipper Loop
trails.summary: A great local trail with a somewhat strenuous climb to warm you up.

trails.name: Aspen Grove Trail
trails.summary: A rocky trail that follows Evans Creek through beautiful aspen groves before a steep ascent to the top of the crest.

trails.name: Incline Flume Trail
trails.summary: Forested trail with great views of Lake Tahoe. Hike this as an out-and-back or point-to-point with a shuttle.

trails.name: Donner Lake Rim Trail: Northwood Boulevard Section
trails.summary: A great section of the Donner Lake Rim Trail with stunning views.

trails.name: Quail Valley Trail
trails.summary: A rocky trail in the vast BLM area above the Caughlin Ranch.

trails.name: Upper Loop
trails.summary: The Upper Loop of Ballardini Ranch figure eight trail system.

trails.name: Old Lookout Trail
trails.summary: A very steep trail to the top of the ridge.

trails.name: Mahogany Forest
trails.summary: A fun trail out to Peavine Road from the second bench at the intersection of Scrub Brush Trail and Bacon Strip.

trails.name: Crispy Bacon
trails.summary: A fun flowy portion up top with technical switchbacks on the bottom end.

trails.name: Scrub Brush Trail
trails.summary: Climb up to the second bench at the top of  Bacon Strip or hike down to Total Recall from same.

trails.name: Snow Terraces Trail
trails.summary: Connects Halo to Poedunk. Some fun rollers at the top, and a bit steep and rocky towards Poedunk.

trails.name: Glacier Way Access Trail
trails.summary: A trail providing access from the Tahoe Donner/Glacier Way Trailhead Parking Area to the DLRT.

trails.name: Granite Chief Trail
trails.summary: A steady but manageable & scenic climb connecting Squaw to the PCT and the summit of Granite Chief.

trails.name: Highland Loop
trails.summary: A lollipop loop that travels into the hills above Hidden Valley.

trails.name: Ophir Creek Trail
trails.summary: A calf-busting climb, mostly shaded by evergreens, leading up to the Tahoe Rim Trail system.

trails.name: Galena Creek Trail
trails.summary: A trail running alongside Galena Creek.

trails.name: Jones Whites Creek Loop
trails.summary: Needs summary and description.

trails.name: Inner Loop
trails.summary: An orderly trail that follows a road trace through the center of Hidden Valley Regional Park.

trails.name: Upper Thomas Creek Trail
trails.summary: Needs Summary
